731595f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731595f-b.text:
(1)
Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, 447 East 115th Street ad-
joining the N.W. corner of Fleasant Avenue, the day before
the Feast Day of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
This church was built here about 1885.
July 15, 1924.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel: members of the upper east
side Italian colony bringing candles to the church.
July 16, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

715107f-a.text:
429-425 East 115th Street, north side, between Pleasant and
First avenues. No. 227 is a two-story frame house.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York

722631f-a.title: Manhattan: Pleasant Avenue - 115th Street
722631f-a.text:
Pleasant Avenue at S.E. corner of 115th Street, showing the refreshment
stand doing a brisk business during the annual Feast of OOur Lady
of Mt. Carmel. (The stlucture is purely tempora y).
This block used to contain tanks and other parts of the Standard Gas
Light Compwny plant.
July 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722632f-a.title: Manhattan: Pleasant Avenue - 115th Street
722632f-a.text:
Pleasant Avenue, at 115th Street, seen from clesring behind the S.E.
corner of 115th Street, former site of the Standard Gas Light
Company's tanks.
at 447 East 115th Street, adjoining the buildings on thc N.W. corner,
is the Church of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, which has occupied the
site since around 1880; it is an Italian Roman Catholic panish.
July 19, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
